item.title: イーロン・マスクは、「センセーショナリズムよりも正確さを求めるインセンティブを最大化」するため、コミュニティ・ノートによって修正されたXの投稿は「収益分配の対象外」になると述べている（Rebecca Bellan/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Rebecca Bellan / TechCrunch:
Elon Musk says X posts corrected by Community Notes will be “ineligible for revenue share” in order to “maximize the incentive for accuracy over sensationalism”  —  X posts that are corrected by Community Notes, the platform's crowd-sourced fact-checking system …

item.title: ルーシー・フレイザー英文化相は、数週間以内に発表される見直しの一環として、BBCの内部規制体制を強化したいと考えている（ダニエル・トーマス/フィナンシャル・タイムズ紙）。
item.description:
Daniel Thomas / Financial Times:
The UK's culture secretary, Lucy Frazer, wants to bolster internal regulatory structures at the BBC as part of a review set be released in the coming weeks  —  Review into national broadcaster will examine internal protocols, Lucy Frazer says  —  Rishi Sunak's government will seek …

item.title: イスラエルとハマスの戦争に関連したAIの偽物は限定的で説得力に欠けるが、そのような偽物が出回る可能性があることから、本物のコンテンツを否定する向きもある（ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
New York Times:
AI fakes related to the Israel-Hamas war have been limited and unconvincing, but the possibility of such fakes circulating leads some to dismiss genuine content  —  Fakes related to the conflict have been limited and largely unconvincing, but their presence has people doubting real evidence.

item.title: かつてリアルタイムのニュースと世界的な討論のハブとして機能していたXの強硬な右傾化と、その政治的転換がビジネス上の苦境をどのように激化させるかを考察する（Washington Post）。
item.description:
Washington Post:
A look at the hard right tilt of X, which once served as the hub of real-time news and global debate, and how its political shift could intensify business woes  —  The billionaire bought Twitter to revive its business and make it less “woke.”  He has succeeded at only one of those goals.

item.title: 情報源BMG、10月27日に従業員40人を解雇、メモによると、レイオフは事実上、録音物などの国際マーケティング部門を「廃止」した（Kristin Robinson/Billboard）
item.description:
Kristin Robinson / Billboard:
Sources: BMG terminated ~40 employees on October 27; memo: the layoffs effectively “discontinued” its international marketing department for recordings and more  —  About 40 employees were let go Thursday, including executive vp, global repertoire Fred Casimir and senior vp, global repertoire Jason Hradil.

item.title: 10月27日以降、通信が遮断されたガザ地区では、衛星回線を使って断続的に最新情報を伝える記者もいる（Laurin-Whitney Gottbrath/Axios）
item.description:
Laurin-Whitney Gottbrath / Axios:
Some reporters in Gaza have been able to give intermittent updates via satellite connections, as a communications blackout since October 27 cuts off the Strip  —  - “If we all got killed in Gaza ... no one will know,” Palestinian journalist Plestia Alaqad said in a post she was able to upload …

item.title: インスタグラムの責任者アダム・モセリは、「パブリッシャーのコンテンツが増え、クリエイターのコンテンツはあまり増えない」という懸念にもかかわらず、スレッドはAPIに取り組んでいると語った（Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Ivan Mehta / TechCrunch:
Instagram head Adam Mosseri says Threads is working on an API, despite concerns that “it'll mean a lot more publisher content and not much more creator content”  —  Instagram head Adam Mosseri said today that a Threads API is in the works.  This will give chance to developers …

item.title: ガザの病院爆発で500人以上が死亡したと大々的に報道されたのは、誤訳とコピーによる悪質な報道のせいかもしれない。
item.description:
David Zweig / Silent Lunch, The David Zweig Newsletter:
How a mistranslation and copying bad reporting may have led to wide coverage that 500+ people died in the Gaza hospital blast; no outlet quoted a primary source  —  I asked a dozen reporters and news outlets for the source of a statement they attributed to Hamas.  None of them answered.

item.title: モルガン・スタンレーは、YouTube TVのNFL Sunday Ticketについて、グーグルは2023年シーズンで$1.204B、2029年シーズンまでに年間$1.409Bの損失を出すと予測（Daniel Frankel/Next TV）
item.description:
Daniel Frankel / Next TV:
Morgan Stanley projects that Google will lose $1.204B in the 2023 season of YouTube TV's NFL Sunday Ticket, and $1.409B annually by the 2029 season  —  Bank's equity research unit forecasts heavy losses on the out-of-market games package through 2029  —  Media business watchers always assumed …

item.title: A360Media傘下のソープ・オペラ・ダイジェストが週刊誌の発行を中止、1975年に創刊された昼ドラ誌は1991年に150万部のピークを迎えた（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
A360Media-owned Soap Opera Digest discontinues its weekly print run; the daytime drama magazine launched in 1975 and saw its circulation peak at 1.5M in 1991  —  Staffers were informed of the decision Friday, according to sources.  A spokesperson for a360Media, the company that owns the brand …

item.title: SAG-AFTRAとスタジオは週末も話し合いを続ける予定。数千人の組合員が、悪い取引に応じるくらいならストライキを続けるという書簡に署名した（Gene Maddaus/Variety）
item.description:
Gene Maddaus / Variety:
SAG-AFTRA and studios plan to keep talking over the weekend; thousands of union members signed a letter saying they'd rather keep striking than take a bad deal  —  The sessions may be held virtually, rather than in person.  —  The two sides met on Friday for the third day this week at SAG-AFTRA headquarters.

item.title: ディズニーは11月にDisney+の広告オプションを拡大する予定で、入札可能なインベントリ、ファーストパーティのオーディエンスグラフからのデータ、ジオターゲティングなどが含まれる（Alyssa Boyle/AdExchanger）
item.description:
Alyssa Boyle / AdExchanger:
Disney plans to expand its advertising options on Disney+ in November, including biddable inventory, data from its first-party audience graph, and geotargeting  —  Disney is celebrating the first birthday of ad-supported Disney+ with a new slate of targeting and measurement options for advertisers.

item.title: ダン・アッカーマンは、2023年6月に彼を雇ったG/O Mediaのギズモードの編集長を退任し、2023年後半から「新しいコンシューマー・テック」EICの役割を始める（Dan Ackerman/Dan Ackerman on LinkedIn）
item.description:
Dan Ackerman / Dan Ackerman on LinkedIn:
Dan Ackerman is stepping down as editor-in-chief of G/O Media's Gizmodo, which hired him in June 2023, and starting a “new consumer tech” EIC role later in 2023  —  Some big career news: I'm stepping down as Editor-in-Chief of Gizmodo and starting an exciting new consumer tech Editor-in-Chief role later this year.

item.title: Xは月額16ドル。Premium+プランでは、For YouやFollowingに広告が表示されず、「最大の返信ブースト」が利用できる。ベーシック・プランには「小さなブースト」があるがチェックマークはない（Emma Roth/The Verge）
item.description:
Emma Roth / The Verge:
X adds a $16/mo. Premium+ plan with no ads in For You or Following and the “largest reply boost”, and a $3/mo. Basic plan with a “small boost” but no checkmark  —  X, the platform previously known as Twitter, has introduced a new $16 per month Premium Plus plan …

item.title: 情報筋BuzzFeedはComplex Networksをeコマース企業Ntwrkに1億4,000万ドル以下で売却する方向で交渉を進めている。
item.description:
Benjamin Mullin / New York Times:
Sources: BuzzFeed is in advanced talks to sell Complex Networks to e-commerce company Ntwrk for less than $140M; BuzzFeed paid ~$300M to acquire Complex in 2021  —  BuzzFeed is negotiating a sale of much of Complex Networks for under $140 million, less than half of what it paid to acquire it two years ago.
